div1.p: Sturgis sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Helen M. Sturgis to Howard A. Kelly, [19--]
div1.opener:
To Dr Howard A Kelly
Ans
Dear Sir-
div1.p:
Having read
your “Life of Walter
Reed” with great
interest, and since
then a letter in
the Outlook, mention-
ing the unfortunate
plight of Mr John R.
Kissinger and his wife,
I am going to ask if
you will kindly for-
ward the enclosed
check for ten dollars
from Dr Sturgis and
myself.

Our best wishes go
with it, and I sin-
cerely hope the govern-
ment will treat them
generously, whether
his trouble is due
to Yellow-fever or not.

Hoping they will
receive many more
contributions.
div1.closer:
I am Very truly yours, Helen M. Sturgis July thirteenth
AC
Ki
Address
Mrs Purdy H. Sturgis
145 Seventh Ave
Brooklyn
N. Y.
